meanings.definition: Votes cast for more candidates than permitted.
meanings.sent1: The election results showed a high number of overvotes, indicating voter confusion.
meanings.sent2: The election officials had to carefully review the ballots to identify any overvotes.
meanings.sent3: The overvotes on the ballots caused delays in announcing the final results.
meanings.sent4: The overvotes in the election were like extra toppings on a pizza - unnecessary and messy.
meanings.sent5: The concept of overvotes can be understood as trying to fit too many puzzle pieces into a single spot.

meanings.definition: To cast too many votes on a ballot.
meanings.sent1: It is important not to overvotes when marking your choices on the ballot.
meanings.sent2: The candidate was disqualified because they encouraged supporters to overvotes.
meanings.sent3: The idea of overvoting may seem tempting, but it can lead to invalidating your ballot.
meanings.sent4: She felt overwhelmed and accidentally overvoted for multiple candidates.
meanings.sent5: Overvoting is like trying to pour too much water into a small cup - it just spills over.

meanings.definition: The act of marking more choices than allowed on a ballot.
meanings.sent1: The overvotes on the ballot were a result of unclear instructions.
meanings.sent2: The overvotes were discovered during the ballot counting process.
meanings.sent3: The overvotes on the ballot made the election more interesting, but also more complicated.
meanings.sent4: Her ballot had so many overvotes that it looked like a colorful rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The impact of overvotes on election outcomes cannot be underestimated.
